lexa.core.expression

Class MultipleExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.expression.Expression
      • lexa.core.expression.MultipleExpression
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Compare, ExpressionList, LogicalAnd, LogicalOr, Numeric

    public abstract class MultipleExpression
extends Expression
    An expression that combines two or more expressions.
    This class must be implemented by all classes that will support multiple expression evaluation. After each expression is evaluated, it is validated and then processing can continue if required.
    Since:
    2013-03
    Author:
    William

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultipleExpression

        protected MultipleExpression(Expression... expressions)
        Create a multiple expression consisting of a list of expressions.
        Parameters:
        expressions - a list of expressions to parse

      • MultipleExpression

        protected MultipleExpression(java.lang.Class<?> classType,
                             Expression... expressions)
        Create a multiple expression consisting of a list of expressions.
        If the class types of the expression is the same as the classType and it's an implementation of MultipleExpression then the the contained expressions are added rather than the container.
        Parameters:
        classType - a class type to allow for concatenation of expressions.
        expressions - a list of expressions to parse

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.Object evaluate(lexa.core.data.DataSet data)
                          throws ExpressionException
        Evaluate a MultipleExpression. Each expression is evaluated in turn until completion. The processes can be interrupted via the methods:
        • validate(Object) checks if the result is valid.
        • combine(Object, Object) combines the existing overall result with the new result.
        • complete(Object) stops processing.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class Expression
        Parameters:
        data - The input to feed the expression.
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in evaluation the expression

      • validate

        protected boolean validate(java.lang.Object result)
                    throws ExpressionException
        Checks if the result of an evaluation is valid.
        The default behaviour is to check the result is not null.
        Parameters:
        result - the result from an evaluated expression.
        Returns:
        true if the result is valid.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in validating the result.

      • combine

        protected abstract java.lang.Object combine(java.lang.Object overall,
                                            java.lang.Object result)
                                     throws ExpressionException
        Combines the existing overall result with the new result.
        Parameters:
        overall - the existing result from the previously evaluated expressions.
        result - the result from an evaluated expression.
        Returns:
        The combined result.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in combining the result.

      • complete

        protected boolean complete(java.lang.Object overall)
                    throws ExpressionException
        Check if processing is completed.
        Parameters:
        overall - the existing result from the previously evaluated expressions.
        Returns:
        false as the process should continue to the end.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in checking the result.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string containing the expressions.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Expression
        Returns:
        a string of expressions
